headline: BlackRock CFO Martin Small Says 'We've Never Shied Away From Taking Big Bets' – Here's What They Look For
summary: BlackRock is on a spending spree. In November, the asset management giant dropped $12 billion to buy private credit firm HPS Investment Partners. And that's just one deal this year. They also grabbed data firm Preqin for $3.2 billion and private-equity powerhouse Global Infrastructure Partners (GIP) for $12.5 billion. "We've never shied away from taking big bets," BlackRock CEO Larry Fink said recently. It's all part of the strategy. BlackRock is building its dominance in private markets, a spac

headline: Vanguard Renewables names new CEO as owner BlackRock looks for growth
summary: The anaerobic digestion company’s former CEO, who held the role since before it was purchased by a division of BlackRock Real Assets, has departed, Vanguard confirmed.

raw.headline: Vanguard Renewables names new CEO as owner BlackRock looks for growth
raw.summary: The anaerobic digestion company’s former CEO, who held the role since before it was purchased by a division of BlackRock Real Assets, has departed, Vanguard confirmed.

headline: Analysis-2024 the 'year of the bond' as record inflows top $600 billion
summary: LONDON (Reuters) -Investors have poured a record $600 billion into global bond funds this year, taking advantage of some of the highest yields in decades ahead of an uncertain 2025.  Dwindling inflation has finally allowed central banks to lower interest rates, pushing investors to lock in the relatively high yields available and finally delivering the "year of the bond" after $250 billion left fixed-income funds in 2022.  "The story is income," said Vasiliki Pachatouridi, head of EMEA iShares fixed income strategy at BlackRock.
